Experience Design Automation Engineer Intel Corporation January 2012  –  July 2015  (3 years 7 months) Design automation engineer providing Unix environment and tool support for major CPU and SOC design teams of 800+ engineers.  
 
• Designed and supported bug tracking database and schema used for 15+ projects. 
• Developed bug tracking change control flow. Created software tools to automate building agendas, updating records, generating reports, and and cloning bugs to other project affected. 
• Created software tools to generate bug tracking indicators. 
• Developed tool that integrates with the component design continuous integration system to update bug records that pass the automated build 
• Provided technical leadership working with a team of 5 to design new internal database capabilities; such as converging on a standard database schema for hardware and software design, record cloning capability to enable sharing and trace-ability. 
• supported component design Unix compute infrastructure; Provided NFS disk space, Unix interactive servers, general Unix support, Unix level tool failure debug. Design Automation Engineer Intel Corporation January 2009  –  2012  (3 years) Creating Unix software tools to support major CPU and SOC design teams of 800+ engineers.  
 
 
•	Developer and support for the primary test run regression tools used by the Major CPU and Phone&Tablet SOC Design products; Used to run +500,000 tests per week 
•	•	Supported internally developed regression test failure triage system used to collect and bucket test run regression tests; managed database schema. 
•	Co-developed software that improved reliability and scalability of the component design continuous integration system; co-developed DB scheme for the migration to Mysql. 
•	Supported Unix design environment, General Unix support, Unix level tool failure debug, Git support during the migration from Bitkeeper to Git. 
 SR Unix System Administrator/programmer Intel Corporation 2001  –  2009  (8 years) 
Unix engineering and support across many disciplines of the Unix infrastructure. Provided training and mentoring to increase skill set of other administrators in the team.  
 
 
• Managed and supported Unix OS image and Netbatch installation for SLES, Redhat, AIX and HPUX  
operating systems for component design teams. 
• engaged with vendors to debug and resolve OS level problem.  
• Large scale administration of 10K+ Unix servers, 2+ Petabytes storage; Site NIS infrastructure owner, Site Sendmail owner, NFS file server administrator, DNS administration, Unix workstation and batch computing administration. 
• Create automation software to manage changes across a 10K+ batch computing pool of systems. 
• Benchmarked of Unix compute platforms and NFS file server performance; Influenced the purchasing in vendor and platform select provide the best platform for component design work flows. 
• Researched SLES9 NFS bug causing BFS file server loading issues. Created software tools in C and perl to collected and analyze production workflow and then created software tools to perform NFS operations level bechmarking. Technical Lead the Windows NT OS image development team.

Summary I am a Cloud Automation Engineer at the Intel Corporation in Chandler, AZ and have been with the company since August of 2005. I am an active community member who strongly advocates volunteer work. I was a Big Sister with the Big Brothers Big Sisters of Central Arizona from 2008-2013. I am an elected Precinct Committeeman in Legislative District 18, Galveston precinct, where I served as the Recording Secretary from 2010-2014. I am also a member of the State Committee for the Arizona Democratic Party. development of High Level Synthesis System (HLS): This program converted a IEE1076.6 compliant VHDL behavioral description into VHDL RTL for input into synthesis tools.  
 
Optimal CMOS layout generation: Designed and Implemented a Physical Synthesis Tool in C++ using STL that compiled Boolean expressions into an area optimized CMOS layout. Module placement using Simulated Annealing: Designed and implemented a Module placement tool in C++ (using STL). The tool was generic enough to allow the annealing process to accept any other cost function to be used optimize the module placement.
